intro: Leschenaultia chlorantha, commonly known as the green leschenaultia, is a flowering plant native to the southern regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, aiding in water retention. The bright yellow flowers bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
